preclusion: SE2281 or SSA2207 or SS2207SE, SC2207
description: This module will cover a wide range of issues concerning the causes, processes, obstacles and consequences of democratic transition in the Philippines, Thailand and Indonesia - three of the largest and the most populous countries of Southeast Asia. The specific issues to be covered include economic growth and stagnation, the middle class, capitalist rule, rural politics, political parties, military coups, corruption, electoral violence, gangsters, social movements, street protests, the monarchy, communal conflicts and female politicians.
title: Democratisation in Southeast Asia
